conclusion: Analyze the flow path of the liquid from points A, B, and C to determine which container it will flow into.
Liquid flows from A, positioned at the top left.
Liquid from A moves downward and to the right, passing through the red baffle.
Liquid from A continues to flow towards the bottom, reaching container E.
Liquid flows from B, positioned at the top center.
Liquid from B moves downward and to the right, passing through the green baffle.
Liquid from B continues to flow towards the bottom, reaching container D.
Liquid flows from C, positioned at the top right.
Liquid from C moves downward and to the left, passing through the green baffle.
Liquid from C continues to flow towards the bottom, reaching container D.
Liquid from A flows into container E, and liquid from B and C flows into container D.
